title: Dc_Yerko's Author Page
content:
[[include component:scp-hover-box-styling]]
[[include theme:i57-theme]]

[[module CSS]]

/* Code taken from the Sigma-9 Themes article. Thank you Ralliston, Lt Flops and Estrellayoshte */

.tcontainer {
    display: flex;
    flex-wrap: wrap;
    justify-content: center;
    align-items: flex-start;
    align-content: space-between;
}

.caser {
    background-color: white;
    width: calc(11rem + 1.5vw);
    padding: 6px;
    margin: 6px;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    border: solid 1px #ccc;
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
    transition: transform .16s;
    line-height: 1.1;
    position: relative;
}

.caser hr {
    margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0;
}

.caser h4 {
    margin-top: 14px;
    margin-bottom: -12px;
}

.caser img.image {
    width: 100%;
    height: calc(10.625rem + 1vw);
    object-fit: cover;
    object-position: top;
}

.caser:hover {
    transform: scale(1.52);
    z-index: 2;
}
.caser:focus-within {
    transform: scale(1.52);
    z-index: 2;
}

.caser:hover .hoverdesc,
.caser .hoverdesc:hover {
    margin-top: 0;
    opacity: 1;
    pointer-events: all;
}
.caser:focus-within .hoverdesc{
    margin-top: 0;
    opacity: 1;
    pointer-events: all;
}

.hoverdesc {
    position: absolute;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    background: white;
    border: solid 1px #ccc;
    width: calc(11rem + 1.5vw);
    top: 100%; left: 50%;
    transform: translateX(-50%);
    margin-top: -5rem;
    padding: 0.4rem;
    opacity: 0;
    font-size: 70%;
    pointer-events: none;
    transition: margin-top 0.3s cubic-bezier(.08,.72,.5,.94), opacity 0.175s linear;
    z-index: -1;
    word-break: unset;
}

.anchor {
    position: sticky;
    height:0;
    top: 0;
}
.sidebox {
    margin-top: 16px;
    max-height: calc(92vh - 24px);
    position: absolute;
    top: 0;
    right: -14em;
    z-index: 4;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    border: solid 1px black;
    background-color: #f8f8f8;
    padding: 15px;
    width: 200px;
}

@media (max-width: 1384px) {
    .sidebox {
        display: none;
    }
}

[[/module]]

[[div class="anchor"]]
[[div class="sidebox"]]
[[div style="background-color: black; color: #eeca03; text-align: center; padding-top: 10px; padding-bottom: 10px;"]]
+++ Open Commisions!
[[/div]]

[[=]]
I want to meet my love, but they lives thousands of miles away. Any donation or comission is welcome. Thank you very much for reading this.

This' what I can do:
[[/=]]

— Writings
— Image Editing
— Logos and Posters
— Themes and Divs
— 3D Voxel Models

Contact me if you're interested.

**Wikidot: [https://www.wikidot.com/user:info/dc-yerko Click here!]**
**Twitter: [https://x.com/Dc_Yerko/status/1702758538718642438 Click here!]**
**Discord:** Dc_Yerko

[[div style="margin: auto;"]]
[[html]]
<script type='text/javascript' src='https://storage.ko-fi.com/cdn/widget/Widget_2.js'></script><script type='text/javascript'>kofiwidget2.init('Donate!', '#000000', 'G2G73TVRO');kofiwidget2.draw();</script> 
[[/html]]
[[/div]]

[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[=]]
+ My Writings
[[/=]]

[[tabview]]
[[tab EN]]

= These are all my works that has been translated and posted in this wiki. All of them has been translated by my good friend [[*user Uncle Nicolini]]. Thank you for that!

[[=]]

[[/=]]

|sub-title=The Doctor of Death
|blerb=,,//"Fall prey to fear and tension when this man, no! This monster raises the dead from their graves!"//,,

----
,,GoI-Format, Herman-Fuller, F-57,,
]]

**Hello, I'm an Incinideer! You will recognize me by my very similar appearance to my cousin the Red Deer and my burning fire antlers. Don't worry! It doesn't hurt me.**
----
,,GoI-Format, Wilson, F-57,,
]]

|link=http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-es-113
|title=SCP-ES-113
|sub-title=Special Deal
|blerb=,,//"Child, I hear you, I hear you, come, get closer, without fear, I want to offer you a special deal."//,,

**SCP-ES-113 is a crude drawing of what is assumed to be a caricature of an unidentified creature possessing animal traits. Once a subject between 5 and 13 years of age is alone in its bathroom, SCP-ES-113 will animate and begin vocalizing.**
----
,,SCP, Keter, Exchange, F-57,,
]]

**SCP-ES-174-A es Arsenio "Colilla" Álvarez, un antiguo miembro de los Chicago Rum Runners, capaz de crear cigarrillos que proporcionan sentimientos de felicidad durante su uso.**
----
,,SCP, Euclid, Weapon, F-57,,

**SCP-ES-193 is a railroad of five railcars and a locomotive that manifested 14 meters above the recreational yard at Facility-33 on April 13, 2013.**
----
,,SCP, Spacetime, F-57,,
]]

**All of this clearly has major consequences throughout the history of the organization. Many things did not happen, many things did not happen in exactly the same way, and many, many more have happened that would not happen in a normal scenario.**
----
,,Hub, F-57,,
]]

|blerb=,,//"We don't have much time left, they're already sending more people! Make it fast!"//,,

**SCP-ES-120 is the collective designation of masses capable of mimicking the appearance of the subject in which they have been grafted, and actively seek the recomposition of the country in which they find themselves.**
----
,,SCP, Keter, Metamorphic, F-57,,
]]

|sub-title=Second Chance
|blerb=,,//"¡I wish I could change things! I wish I could do everything again!"//,,

**SCP-ES-117 is a spontaneous manifestation that happens in rural areas. A man runs with a dead woman in his arms, reaches a stone bed, and shouts a phrase before they both disappear.**
----
,,SCP, Safe, Humanoid, Sentient,,
]]

= Want even more of my content? Check the "ES" tab!

[[/tab]]
[[tab ES]]

= You can find all my works in my home, the Hispanic Branch, by clicking **[http://lafundacionscp.wikidot.com/dc-yerko here!]**. All my stuff is born there, so I'm afraid those are not in english, but in Spanish. You can find them in the "Escritos" tab.

= Thank you for your interest in my works, I hope you enjoy them!

[[=]]
+ Information

[[tabview]]
[[tab Personnel File]]

[[include component:image-block name=https://lafundacionscp.wdfiles.com/local--files/dc-yerko/Venceslao.gif|caption=DC Yerko|width=300px]]

**Name:** Yerko Venceslao Nemanja Gerbic Jankovic

**Serial Number:** 021-472-197-K

**Nationality:** Chilean

**Age:** 57 years old

**Height:** 1.85m

**Ranks:** Director of the Latin America Regional Council, Director of Facility-57, Director of the Commission for Humanoid Object Containment in Latin America, Chief Investigator of SCP-ES-███.

**Security Clearance Level:** 5

**Location:** [REDACTED]

----

**Background:**

Hardworking and reserved, Venceslao has served as director of Facility-57 since the death of the Ancient One, dedicating his life to his work and using the phone constantly to answer calls and send messages to those below him in the hierarchy in a way to obtain knowledge and/or management of the situations occurring in the Hispanic American region, or so his witnesses think.

Of few words, he tends to limit his relationships with staff to those closest to him in the hierarchy, and even then it is difficult to see him without sunglasses and looking at his cell phone screen, even indoors.

While not anomalous, his life has not been devoid of encounters with anomalies, while he's mostly the man watching from afar, on a few rare occasions he's had to deal with them himself. Although the records of this are usually private, that doesn't stop staff from ruminating about his past life, his attachment to work, and his strange behaviors.

But discussion regarding his person is no match for those that focus on those that attempt to probe into the mind of this person and the intentions he has for Facility-57 and the Region itself. Reserved and quiet about his moves, some accuse him of resting his feet on an impenetrable ivory tower that he might one day turn into the lair of his tyranny, one that would make the Ancient One even more missed.

Indifferent to rumors and criticism, Venceslao silently continues on his way; perhaps not a politician, but a man of science and action.

[[collapsible show="ERROR‎" hide="‏‏‎ ‎"]]

----

**Background:**

Reserved and distant, the man who calls himself Yerko Venceslao is a strange and mysterious figure to most of the staff who always see him performing different jobs throughout the Site-34, from cook, receptionist or researcher, to simply a janitor, among others.

Those who have approached him have had varying degrees of success, from those who can't understand what he is trying to say, to those who manage to have long and fluent conversations. One thing that always recurs is the ominous, nostalgic regrets about his past, but which he never wants or succeeds in revealing.

Occasionally, he will tell some people that he already knew them before, and will say facts to prove it that are usually incorrect but close to the truth, but sometimes they are right. This includes people he is meeting for the first time.

Sometimes mistaken for an anomalous apparition, some concerned investigators and agents have reported his presence or tried to investigate him closely but it has never been possible to prove that he possesses paranormal abilities.

His true position at the Site is a mystery ignored by those closest to him, and the reasons why he is allowed to continue wandering the facility are an even greater unknown. Either way, Venceslao is still there, always there, working on something, mostly in silence.

[[/collapsible]]

[[/tab]]
[[tab Canon]]

[[include component:image-block name= http://lafundacionscp.wdfiles.com/local--files/theme:i-57/I-57-Logo.png|caption=Canon Isotype|width=225px]]

+ Facility-57

**[http://scp-int.wikidot.com/i-57-hub Facility-57]** is a ES' canon about alternative history in which The Foundation is controlled both by its members and by the presidents of the regions of the world into which it is divided. The answer to a series of questions: "What if The Foundation had not been clandestine? What if it had been politicized? What if it were organized into regions? What good and what harm would governments do by mixing their interests with those of The Foundation?", among many others.

While the DNA of the canon is politics, a fundamental part of it is also the resulting scenario of its history away from the underground. In other words, not only is it important how Interest Groups and Anomalous Communities govern and organize their societies, but equally important are the consequences of their decisions in people.

This leaves us with a wide range of possibilities, from the administrative meetings of the Foundation's top officials, to the consequences that a dictatorship can have for the anomalous families, to the geopolitical war that develops when large groups wish to have control, power, or monopoly over the anomalous world behind the Veil.

In short, the world is full of tyrants and dreamers. I wonder which of the two groups you belong to.

[[/tab]]
[[tab About]]

[[include component:image-block name=https://lafundacionscp.wdfiles.com/local--files/dc-yerko/Yo.png|caption=Soy ese|width=300px]]

My name is Yerko, and I make attempts at writing for people who are pretty without trying.

I mainly focus on creating stories that inside my mind look like little movies, but sometimes I also make smaller articles that may or may not end up being part of something else, sometimes I just like to have a little fun and create short stories as glimpses of interactions between personnel or characters of my friends, and sometimes I just like to do what my heart tells me to do.

I may not be the person with the most original ideas, and many times the topics I like to touch on have already been touched on by dozens or hundreds before, but whenever I do something, I always look to give it a twist, or add a detail that makes it different. Sometimes it will turn out better, sometimes it will turn out worse, but I always try to put a little bit of myself into what I do.

I've been in this hobby for many years, writing a lot, but deleting more, too much more. If you knew how many drafts I have in both digital and physical format that I deleted or never got around to publishing, you wouldn't be able to count them, or at least I'm not able to.

Still, I have fun writing, and I love getting to that point where I feel good enough about something to show it to you guys, and see what you think of what I've done. Votes are fine and all, but it's in your comments, in your discussion, in your time, in your art, and in your emotions that I find my greatest and most sincere happiness.

Perhaps saying that writing is just a hobby for me can feel like a lie and an insult to my own heart, and while it may be more comfortable to delude myself, the truth is that life sometimes demands different paths if we want something as simple as survival. If dreams could come true, I would eat from writing and live from listening to what they might say about my writings.

Although reason tells me that these are desires of impossible things, I pursue every day, with every writing and publication, this dream that rests at the end of a road full of time bombs. If you wish to help me, --[https://ko-fi.com/dc_yerko here is my kofi]-- I will always want to hear your comments. You can find all my articles in the My Writings section above.

Regardless of how uncertain the future may be, there is one thing I will always know about tomorrow, and that is that I will be forever grateful for my time here with all of you.

PEPSIE
[[/tab]]
[[/tabview]]
